definitions: organized crime syndicate in Japan known for strict codes and hierarchical structure
examples: The yakuza controlled many businesses in the district
Police launched a crackdown on yakuza activities nationwide

definitions: starchy tuberous root vegetable with rough brown skin and white flesh
examples: She roasted yams with butter and brown sugar
The market sells both sweet potatoes and true yams

definitions: bright, positive, masculine principle in Chinese philosophy complementing yin
examples: The symbol shows yin and yang in perfect balance
Yang represents light, warmth, and active energy

definitions: high-pitched sharp bark typically made by small dogs
examples: The tiny dog's constant yap annoyed the neighbors
She could hear the yap of puppies from next door

definitions: total number of yards gained, covered, or needed in sports or fabric
examples: The quarterback threw for impressive yardage this season
Calculate the yardage needed for making new curtains

definitions: three-foot ruler used for measuring lengths up to one yard
standard or criterion used to judge or measure something
examples: He used a yardstick to measure the window frame
The teacher kept a yardstick beside the chalkboard
Profit margin serves as a yardstick for business success
Test scores became the yardstick for evaluating school performance

definitions: continuous strand of twisted fibers used for knitting or weaving
long rambling story often exaggerated or hard to believe
examples: She bought colorful yarn for her knitting project
The sweater required three skeins of wool yarn
Grandfather loved spinning yarns about his sailing days
The fisherman told yarns about the one that got away

definitions: twisting or oscillating movement of a ship or aircraft around vertical axis
examples: The plane experienced sudden yaw in the turbulence
The captain corrected the ship's yaw with the rudder

definitions: wide gap or opening that resembles an open mouth
examples: A yawning chasm opened in the earthquake-damaged road
The yawning entrance to the cave looked intimidating

definitions: formal expression of agreement or affirmative vote in deliberative assembly
examples: The senator cast her yea vote for the bill
The yeas outnumbered the nays by a wide margin

definitions: book published annually containing photographs and information about a school's students and activities
examples: Students eagerly signed each other's yearbooks on graduation day
The yearbook committee worked hard to capture memorable moments

definitions: animal, especially a horse or cattle, between one and two years old
examples: The rancher separated yearlings from the younger calves
The yearling colt showed promise for racing

definitions: period of twelve months or something occurring once per year
examples: The company holds its yearly meeting in January
Employees receive a yearly performance review and raise

definitions: intense feeling of longing or desire for something absent or distant
examples: She felt a deep yearning for her childhood home
His yearning for adventure led him to travel abroad

definitions: single-celled fungus used in baking and brewing to cause fermentation
examples: Add yeast to warm water before mixing the dough
The brewery uses special yeast strains for different beers

definitions: act of shouting or crying out loudly, often in anger or excitement
examples: The yelling from the crowd made conversation impossible
Constant yelling in the household created a stressful environment

definitions: large tropical tuna with bright yellow fins prized for eating
examples: The restaurant serves fresh yellowfin tuna sashimi daily
Fishermen caught several yellowfin on their deep-sea expedition

definitions: large game fish with yellow tail fin found in warm ocean waters
examples: The sushi chef prepared yellowtail with perfect precision
Anglers prize yellowtail for their fighting spirit

definitions: short sharp cry of pain, surprise, or excitement
examples: The puppy let out a yelp when stepped on
She gave a yelp of delight upon seeing the surprise

definitions: basic monetary unit of Japan consisting of one hundred sen
strong desire or urge for something
examples: The tourist exchanged dollars for yen at the airport
The price tag showed five thousand yen
She had a yen for chocolate after dinner
His yen for adventure took him around the world

definitions: small landowner who cultivated his own land in historical England
petty officer in navy performing clerical duties
examples: Medieval yeomen formed the backbone of English society
The yeoman farmer worked his modest holdings diligently
The yeoman processed paperwork in the ship's office
She served as yeoman second class in the navy

definitions: Jewish institution for religious study of Torah and Talmud
examples: He studied at a prestigious yeshiva in Jerusalem
The yeshiva attracted scholars from around the world

definitions: past time remembered with nostalgia, especially the recent past
examples: The museum displays fashions from yesteryear
Stories of yesteryear fascinated the young listeners

definitions: large hairy humanlike creature supposedly living in the Himalayas
examples: Expeditions searched for evidence of the yeti in Nepal
Local legends describe yeti sightings in mountain passes

definitions: evergreen coniferous tree with poisonous red berries and dark green needles
examples: Ancient yew trees grow in the churchyard
The archer carved his bow from yew wood

definitions: action of giving way under pressure or producing a return
examples: The yielding of the old bridge worried engineers
Proper yielding at intersections prevents many accidents

definitions: dark, passive, feminine principle in Chinese philosophy complementing yang
examples: Yin represents coolness, darkness, and receptive energy
The doctor explained how yin and yang affect health

definitions: brief high-pitched bark or cry typically from small dogs
examples: The terrier's excited yip announced visitors arriving
A yip from the bushes revealed the hidden puppy

definitions: form of singing involving rapid changes between normal and falsetto voice
examples: The Alpine shepherd's yodel echoed through the valley
She learned to yodel from Swiss mountain guides

definitions: Hindu spiritual and ascetic discipline including breath control, meditation, and specific body postures
examples: She practices yoga every morning for flexibility and peace
The yoga studio offers classes for all skill levels

definitions: thick creamy food made from milk fermented by bacteria cultures
examples: She topped her granola with plain yoghurt and berries
The recipe calls for Greek yoghurt instead of sour cream

definitions: person proficient in yoga or following its philosophy and practices
examples: The experienced yogi demonstrated advanced poses effortlessly
Many yogis travel to India for spiritual retreats

definitions: thick creamy food made from milk fermented by bacteria cultures
examples: The smoothie recipe includes frozen yogurt and fruit
Probiotic yogurt supports digestive health

definitions: wooden crosspiece fastened over necks of two animals pulling together
something that oppresses or burdens like heavy responsibility
examples: The farmer fitted the yoke on his oxen team
The wooden yoke distributed weight evenly between animals
They struggled under the yoke of colonial rule
Breaking free from the yoke of debt took years

definitions: yellow spherical part of an egg surrounded by the white
examples: Separate the yolk from the white for this recipe
The bright orange yolk indicates a healthy chicken

definitions: child or young person, especially between childhood and adult age
examples: The youngsters played soccer in the neighborhood park
Local youngsters volunteered for the community cleanup

definitions: basic monetary unit of China officially called renminbi
examples: The price was listed as fifty yuan
She exchanged euros for yuan before visiting Beijing

definitions: plant with sword-shaped leaves and white flowers native to hot regions
examples: Yucca plants thrive in the desert landscape
The garden featured several varieties of flowering yucca

definitions: round tent of felt or skins used by nomads in Central Asia
examples: The family lived in a traditional yurt on the steppes
Modern yurts serve as unique camping accommodations

definitions: sharp change of direction in a zigzag course
examples: The skier executed a perfect zag down the slope
After each zig comes a corresponding zag

definitions: amusingly unconventional person who behaves in a silly or eccentric way
examples: The party's zany kept everyone laughing all night
Every office needs a zany to lighten the mood

definitions: sudden burst of energy, sound, or movement, especially electrical
examples: A zap of static electricity shocked her finger
The microwave gave a strange zap before breaking

definitions: great energy or enthusiasm in pursuit of a cause or objective
examples: Her zeal for environmental protection inspired others
Religious zeal motivated the missionaries' work

definitions: person who is fanatical and uncompromising in pursuit of ideals
examples: Political zealots disrupted the peaceful demonstration
The zealot refused to consider opposing viewpoints

definitions: African wild horse with black and white stripes covering its body
examples: The zebra grazed peacefully on the savanna grass
Each zebra has a unique pattern of stripes

definitions: domesticated ox with a humped back native to Asia and Africa
examples: Farmers in India commonly raise zebu for milk
The zebu tolerates heat better than European cattle

definitions: British and Commonwealth pronunciation of the letter Z
examples: In Canada, they pronounce Z as zed not zee
The spelling ended with a zed in British English

definitions: American pronunciation of the letter Z in the alphabet
examples: American children learn to say zee for the letter Z
The alphabet song ends with zee in the United States
